meanings.definition: Having or relating to a stalk or pedicel.
meanings.sent1: The pediculates flower swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The pediculates stem supported the delicate blossom.
meanings.sent3: The pediculates leaves looked like tiny green fingers waving.
meanings.sent4: The pediculates branches reached out like arms to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The pediculates structure of the plant made it stand out in the garden.

meanings.definition: An organism that has or is covered with small stalks or pedicels.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was a pediculates creature crawling on the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The moss on the tree trunk was a pediculates organism.
meanings.sent3: The pediculates bug seemed to be wearing a coat of tiny sticks.
meanings.sent4: The vine looked like a pediculates blanket covering the wall.
meanings.sent5: The sea anemone was a pediculates wonder of nature in the tide pool.
